summary: Diff adds a frontend-only deployment diagnostics UI (dialog + hook + error parser) that can classify errors as build vs deploy and display/copy details, but it does not show evidence of actually retrying/executing a new build+deploy attempt or surfacing actionable failure output to the developer/operator running the deployment pipeline.

missing_requirements.requirement: Retry the application build and deployment process that previously failed (execute a new build + deploy attempt).
missing_requirements.reason: All changes shown are frontend React components/hooks/utilities. There is no evidence of changes to build/deploy scripts, CI/CD configuration, or deployment tooling that would trigger or implement a new build+deploy attempt.

missing_requirements.requirement: If deployment fails, failure output for the developer/operator includes the exact underlying error message and clearly indicates which step failed (build vs canister deploy).
missing_requirements.reason: The diff implements client-side parsing/display of an error string (via query params/localStorage) but does not show evidence that the actual deployment process emits/prints this information in the deployment logs/output or that the failing step is captured from real build/deploy execution.
